concept.title: Pipeline Statistics
concept.shortdesc: A job defines the pipeline to run and the s that run the pipeline. When you start a job, remotely runs the pipeline on the group of s. To monitor the job statistics and metrics within , you must configure the pipeline to write statistics to or to another system.

conbody.p: Control Hubaggregated statisticspipelinesaggregated statistics for Control Hubaggregated statisticspipelinesWhen a job runs on a single , you can simply configure the pipeline to write the statistics directly to . By default, pipelines are configured to write statistics directly to .

When a job runs on multiple s, a remote pipeline instance runs on each of the s. To view aggregated statistics for the job within , you must configure the pipeline to write the statistics to one of the following systems:

When you start a job that includes a pipeline configured to write to Kafka, Kinesis, MapR Streams, or SDC RPC, automatically generates and runs a system pipeline for the job. The system pipeline reads the statistics written by each running pipeline instance to Kafka, Kinesis, MapR Streams, or SDC RPC. Then, the system pipeline aggregates and sends the statistics to .
When a job includes a pipeline that is configured to write statistics, you can view the statistics and metrics when you monitor the job in :
When a job includes a pipeline that is configured to discard statistics, cannot display statistics and metrics for the job. Instead, displays the following warning message when you monitor the job:
conbody.codeblock: Aggregated metrics for the job are not available as individual pipeline metrics are discarded.
